p: Moreover, survivorship of female moths was also significantly affected according to the parametric ( df = 19, F = 24.379, Duncan test) and non parametric statistical analysis ( x 2 = 13.1991, Kruskall – Wallis test ). Thus, the female mean longevity was 20.4 ± 2.1d when they left to lay eggs on oviposition substrates that were treated with ULV of C. citratus, 15.4 ± 4.1 when treated with ULV of G. procumbens, 1 ± 0.8 when treated with R. officinalis and 23.2 ± 6.4d for the control ( Fig. 8).
